meanings.definition: A flat surface on which pictures or words are shown.
meanings.sent1: The movie theater had a large screen for everyone to watch.
meanings.sent2: I looked at the screen to see the latest news updates.
meanings.sent3: The screen blushed when it displayed the embarrassing photo.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the screen like a beacon of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The screen glowed with vibrant colors, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: A protective covering that keeps out insects or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The window screen prevented bugs from entering the house.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the screen over the delicate plant to shield it from dust.
meanings.sent3: The screen chuckled to itself, proud of keeping the room clean.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a screen, shielding her from the harsh truth.
meanings.sent5: The screen acted as a faithful guardian, protecting the precious items behind it.

meanings.definition: To examine or test someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will screen the patient for any signs of illness.
meanings.sent2: They will screen the job applicants to find the most qualified candidate.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to screen the suspect's alibi for any inconsistencies.
meanings.sent4: She tried to screen his intentions, looking for any hidden motives.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will screen the students' understanding of the topic through a quiz.

meanings.definition: To hide or protect someone or something from view.
meanings.sent1: She used the umbrella to screen herself from the sun's harsh rays.
meanings.sent2: He tried to screen his emotions, not wanting others to see his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The magician used smoke to screen his disappearance from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The trees screened the house from the view of passersby.
meanings.sent5: The clouds screened the moon, casting a shadow over the landscape.
